name: Kubernetes
description: Deploy, configure, update a Kubernetes cluster in Azure Container Service by running kubectl commands
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: kubernetesServiceEndpoint
inputs.label: Kubernetes service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Kubernetes service connection.

inputs.name: namespace
inputs.label: Namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the namespace for the kubectl command by using the â€“namespace flag. If the namespace is not provided, the commands will run in the default namespace.

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select or specify a kubectl command to run.

inputs.name: useConfigurationFile
inputs.label: Use Configuration files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use Kubernetes configuration file with the kubectl command. Filename, directory, or URL to Kubernetes configuration files can also be provided.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Configuration file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Filename, directory, or URL to kubernetes configuration files that will be used with the commands.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to the specified kubectl command.

inputs.name: secretType
inputs.label: Type of secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create/update a generic or docker imagepullsecret. Select dockerRegistry to create/update the imagepullsecret of the selected registry. An imagePullSecret is a way to pass a secret that contains a container registry password to the Kubelet so it can pull a private image on behalf of your Pod.

inputs.name: secretArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify keys and literal values to insert in secret.For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: containerRegistryType
inputs.label: Container Registry type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Container registry type. The task can use Azure Subscription details to work with an Azure Container registry. Other standard Container registries are also supported.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Registry service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

inputs.name: azureSubscriptionEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription, which contains Azure Container Registry. Note: To configure new service connection, select the Azure subscription from the list and click 'Authorize'. If your subscription is not listed or if you want to use an existing Service Principal, you can setup an Azure service connection using 'Add' or 'Manage' button.
inputs.visibleRule: secretType = dockerRegistry && containerRegistryType = Azure Container Registry

inputs.name: azureContainerRegistry
inputs.label: Azure Container Registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure Container Registry which will be used for pulling container images and deploying applications to the Kubernetes cluster. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.
inputs.visibleRule: secretType = dockerRegistry && containerRegistryType = Azure Container Registry

inputs.name: secretName
inputs.label: Secret name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the secret. You can use this secret name in the Kubernetes YAML configuration file.

inputs.name: forceUpdate
inputs.label: Force update secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the secret if it exists and create a new one with updated values.

inputs.name: configMapName
inputs.label: ConfigMap name
inputs.helpMarkDown: ConfigMaps allow you to decouple configuration artifacts from image content to keep containerized applications portable.

inputs.name: forceUpdateConfigMap
inputs.label: Force update configmap
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the configmap if it exists and create a new one with updated values.

inputs.name: useConfigMapFile
inputs.label: Use file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create a ConfigMap from an individual file, or from multiple files by specifying a directory.

inputs.name: configMapFile
inputs.label: ConfigMap file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a file or directory that contains the configMaps

inputs.name: configMapArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify keys and literal values to insert in configMap.For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: versionOrLocation
inputs.label: Kubectl
inputs.helpMarkDown: kubectl is a command line interface for running commands against Kubernetes clusters.

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version Spec of version to get.  Examples: 1.7.0, 1.x.0, 4.x.0, 6.10.0

inputs.name: checkLatest
inputs.label: Check for latest version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Always checks online for the latest available version (stable.txt) that satisfies the version spec. This is typically false unless you have a specific scenario to always get latest. This will cause it to incur download costs when potentially not necessary, especially with the hosted build pool.

inputs.name: specifyLocation
inputs.label: Path to Kubectl
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full path to the kubectl.exe

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for the Kubectl command.

inputs.name: outputFormat
inputs.label: Output format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Output format.

inputs.name: kubectlOutput
inputs.label: Output variable name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the variable in which output of the command should be saved.

messages.ReturningToolRunnerExecPromise: Called Toolrunner exec() method asynchronously. Returning the promise.
messages.ToolRunnerExecCallFailed: Toolrunner exec() method returned error for the kubectl command. Error: %s.
messages.ToolRunnerExecCallSucceeded: Toolrunner exec() method returned successfully for the kubectl command.
messages.UsingLatestStableVersion: Invalid version 1.7 specified in Version Spec input. Using latest stable version instead. Check for correct versions https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/releases
messages.ConfigurationFileNotFound: No configuration file matching %s was found.
